thread.title: Uber responds to leaked financials: 'Shock, horror, we make a loss'
thread.title_full: Uber responds to leaked financials: 'Shock, horror, we make a loss'

author: James Titcomb
title: Uber responds to leaked financials: 'Shock, horror, we make a loss'
text:
Comments 
Uber has responded to leaked documents showing the controversial taxi-hailing company is heavily lossmaking, saying it is "a case of business 101". 
The $51bn company, the world's highest-valued startup, has lost tens of millions of dollars according to documents leaked to Gawker , despite revenues growing rapidly. 
They showed that in the second quarter of 2014 alone, the company lost $108.8m, up from $56.5m in the whole of 2013. 
This is despite revenue rising rapidly, from $104.4m in 2013 to $102.6m in the first six months of 2014 alone. 
"Shock, horror, Uber makes a loss," the company said in response. 
"This is hardly news, and old news at that. It's a case of business 101: you raise money, you invest money, you grow (hopefully), you make a profit and that generates a return for investors." 
Uber has aggressively expanded across the world in recent years, but is investing heavily in technology, as well as marketing and legal fees, as it attempts to win over regulators and public opinion. 
The company is accused by many opponents of breaking the law, abusing employment rights , and overstating the benefits of working for the company. Its ability to undercut traditional taxi services has, however, won it a legion of fans. 
Gawker's documents showed that its costs and expenses in the second quarter of 2014, at $163.8m, outstripped those in the whole of 2013. 
Uber has been raising huge amounts of money at regular intervals. Last week, it reportedly raised $1bn at a $51bn valuation . This makes it the highest-valued startup in the world, equalling Facebook's record before it went public. 
Such huge investments mean the company is unlikely to be too troubled by its losses, especially with revenues growing rapidly.
